member.name: T:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS
member.summary: Manipulation of Surveyor SVS (Stereo Vision System) board.

remarks.para: The class allows to manipulate with Surveyor SVS board (stereo vision system) - getting video from both cameras, manipulating motors and servos, reading ultrasonic modules' values, sending direct commands, etc.
This class essentially creates to instances of class to communicate with both SVS's cameras (ports 10001 and 10002 are used) and directs all calls through them.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.Connect(System.String)

remarks.para: The method establishes connection to SVS board. If it succeeds then other methods can be used to manipulate the board.

para.note: The method calls before making any connection attempts to make sure previous connection is closed.

member.exception: Failed connecting to SVS.

remarks.para: The method disconnects from SVS board making all other methods unavailable (except method). In the case if user obtained instance of left or right camera using method, the video will be stopped automatically (and those instances should be discarded).

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.GetCamera(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.Camera)
member.returns: Returns object, which is connected to SVS's Blackfin camera. Use method to start the camera and start receiving video frames from it.

remarks.para: The method provides an instance of , which can be used for receiving continuous video frames from the SVS board. In the case if only one image is required, the method can be used.
Sample usage:

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.GetImage(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.Camera)
member.summary: Get single image from the SVS board.
member.returns: Returns image received from the specified camera of the SVS board or if failed decoding provided response.

remarks.para: The method provides single video frame retrieved from the specified SVS's camera. However in many cases it is required to receive video frames one after another, so the method is more preferred for continuous video frames.

member.exception: Not connected to SRV-1. Connect to SRV-1 before using this method.
Connection lost or communicaton failure. Try to reconnect.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.GetDirectAccessToSRV1(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.Camera)
member.summary: Get direct access to one of the SVS's SRV-1 Blackfin cameras.
member.param: SRV-1 Blackfin to get direct access to.
member.returns: Returns object connected to the requested SRV-1 Blackfin camera.

remarks.para: The method provides direct access to one of the SVS's SRV-1 Blackfin cameras, so it could be possible to send some direct commands to it using and methods.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.GetVersion
member.summary: Get SVS board's firmware version string.
member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.
Connection lost or communicaton failure. Try to reconnect.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.GetRunningTime
member.returns: Returns SVS boards running time in milliseconds.
member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.
Connection lost or communicaton failure. Try to reconnect.
Failed parsing response from SVS.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.RunMotors(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Run motors connected to the SVS board.
member.param: Time duration to run motors measured in number of 10 milliseconds (0 for infinity), [0, 255].

remarks.para: The method sets specified speed to both motors connected to the SVS board. The maximum absolute speed equals to 127, but the sign specifies direction of motor's rotation (forward or backward).

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.StopMotors

remarks.para: The method stops both motors connected to the SVS board by calling method specifying 0 for motors' speed.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.EnableFailsafeMode(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables fail safe mode - setting motors' speed after timeout.

remarks.para: In the case if fail safe mode is enabled and no commands are received by SVS robot withing 2 seconds, motors' speed will be set to the specified values. The command is very useful to instruct robot to stop if no other commands were sent within 2 last seconds (probably lost connection).

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.DisableFailsafeMode

remarks.para: The method disable fail safe mode, which was set using method.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.ControlMotors(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.MotorCommand)
member.summary: Control motors connected to SVS board using predefined commands.
member.param: Motor command to send to the SVS board.

para.note: Controlling SVS motors with this method is only available after at least one direct motor command is sent, which is done using or methods.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.ControlServos(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.ServosBank,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Direct servos control of the SVS board.

remarks.para: The method performs servos control of the SVS board. For and banks it calls method for the corresponding SRV-1 Blackfin camera. In the case of or , the method sends 'Sab' SRV-1 command (see SRV-1 Control Protocol) to the appropriate SRV-1 Blackfin camera.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.UltrasonicPing(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.Camera)
member.param: SRV-1 Blackfin camera to check ultrasonic modules values.
member.returns: Returns array of ranges (distances) obtained from ultrasonic sensors. The ranges are measured in inches.

remarks.para: The method calls for the specified SRV-1 Blackfin camera.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.
Connection lost or communicaton failure. Try to reconnect.
Failed parsing response from SVS.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.I2CReadByte(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.Camera,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.param: SRV-1 Blackfin camera to access I2C device on.
member.returns: Returns byte read from the specified register of the specified I2C device.

para.note: The IC2 device ID should be specified in 7 bit notation. This means that low bit of the ID is not used for specifying read/write mode as in 8 bit notation. For example, if I2C device IDs are 0x44 for reading and 0x45 for writing in 8 bit notation, then it equals to 0x22 device ID in 7 bit notation.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.
Connection lost or communicaton failure. Try to reconnect.
Failed parsing response from SRV-1.

member.summary: Write two bytes to I2C device.
member.param: SRV-1 Blackfin camera to access I2C device on.
I2C device register to write to.
First byte to write to the specified register of the specified device.

For example, if I2C device IDs are 0x44 for reading and 0x45 for writing in 8 bit notation, then it equals to 0x22 device ID in 7 bit notation.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.SetQuality(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set video quality for both cameras.

remarks.para: The method sets video quality for both SVS cameras, which is specified in [1, 8] range - 1 is the highest quality level, 8 is the lowest quality level.

para.note: Setting higher quality level and resolution may increase delays for other requests sent to SVS. So if robot is used not only for video, but also for controlling servos/motors, and higher response level is required, then do not set very high quality and resolution.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.
Invalid quality level was specified.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.SetResolution(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.VideoResolution)
member.summary: Set video resolution for both cameras.

para.note: Setting higher quality level and resolution may increase delays for other requests sent to SVS. So if robot is used not only for video, but also for controlling servos/motors, and higher response level is required, then do not set very high quality and resolution.

member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.FlipVideo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Flip video capture for both cameras or not (for use with upside-down camera).
member.param: Specifies if video should be flipped (), or not ().
member.exception: Not connected to SVS. Connect to SVS board before using this method.

remarks.para: The property keeps SVS's IP address if the class is connected to SVS board, otherwise it equals to .
The property equals to if the class is connected to SVS board, otherwise it equals to .

para.note: The property is not updated by the class, when connection was lost or communication failure was detected (which results into exception). The property only shows status of method.

remarks.para: Since SVS board consists of two SRV-1 Blackfin cameras, the enumeration is used by different methods to specify which one to access.

member.name: F:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.ServosBank.Bank0
member.summary: First bank of the first () SRV-1 Blackfin camera, timers 2 and 3 (marked as TMR2-1 and TMR3-1 on the SVS board). Note: these timers on SVS board are supposed for controlling motors by default (see and ), so use 0th servos bank only when you've done proper configuration changes on SVS side.

member.name: F:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.ServosBank.Bank1
member.summary: Second bank of the first () SRV-1 Blackfin camera, timers 6 and 7 (marked as TMR6-1 and TMR7-1 on the SVS board).

member.name: F:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.ServosBank.Bank2
member.summary: First bank of the second () SRV-1 Blackfin camera, timers 2 and 3 (marked as TMR2-2 and TMR3-2 on the SVS board).

member.name: F:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SVS.ServosBank.Bank3
member.summary: Second bank of the second () SRV-1 Blackfin camera, timers 6 and 7 (marked as TMR6-2 and TMR7-2 on the SVS board).

member.name: T:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1
member.summary: Manipulation of Surveyor SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera.

remarks.para: The class allows to manipulate with Surveyor SRV-1 Blackfin Robot - getting video from its camera, manipulating motors and servos, reading ultrasonic modules' values, sending direct commands, etc.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.Connect(System.String,System.Int32)

remarks.para: The method establishes connection to SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera. If it succeeds then other methods can be used to manipulate the robot.

para.note: The method calls before making any connection attempts to make sure previous connection is closed.

member.exception: Failed connecting to SRV-1.

remarks.para: The method disconnects from SRV-1 robot making all other methods unavailable (except method). In the case if user obtained instance of camera using method, the video will be stopped automatically (and those instances should be discarded).

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.GetCamera
member.summary: Get camera object for the SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera.
member.returns: Returns object, which is connected to SRV1 Blackfin camera. Use method to start the camera and start receiving video frames it.

remarks.para: The method provides an instance of , which can be used for receiving continuous video frames from the SRV-1 Blackfin camera. In the case if only one image is required, the method can be used.
Sample usage:

member.exception: Not connected to SRV-1. Connect to SRV-1 robot/camera before using this method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.Send(System.Byte[])
member.param: Array of bytes (command) to send to SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera.

remarks.para: The method puts specified command into communication queue and leaves immediately. Once internal communication thread becomes free from sending/receiving previous commands/replies, it will send the queued command.
The method is useful for those SRV-1 commands, which does not assume any response data in the command's reply.

para.note: Since the method only queues a communication request, it does not provide any status of request's delivery and it does not generate any exceptions on failure.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.SendAndReceive(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Enqueue communication request and wait for reply.
member.param: Array of bytes (command) to send to SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera.
member.returns: Returns total bytes read into the response buffer.

remarks.para: The method puts specified command into communication queue and waits until the command is sent to SRV-1 Blackfin robot and reply is received.

para.note: If SRV-1 responds with more data than response buffer can fit, then the response buffer will take all the data it can store, but the rest of response will be discarded. The only exception is image request - if response buffer is too small to fit image response, then exception is thrown. It is user's responsibility to provide response buffer of the correct size. Check definition of the SRV-1 Control Protocol for information about supported commands and responses.

member.exception: Not connected to SRV-1.
Connection lost or communicaton failure.
Response buffer is too small.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.GetImage
member.summary: Get single image from the SRV-1 Blackfin camera.
member.returns: Returns image received from the SRV-1 Blackfin camera or if failed decoding provided response.

remarks.para: The method provides single video frame retrieved from the SRV-1 Blackfin camera. However in many cases it is required to receive video frames one after another, so the method is more preferred for continuous video frames.

member.exception: Not connected to SRV-1. Connect to SRV-1 before using this method.
Connection lost or communicaton failure. Try to reconnect.

member.returns: Returns SRV-1 running time in milliseconds.
member.exception: Not connected to SRV-1. Connect to SRV-1 before using this method.
Connection lost or communicaton failure. Try to reconnect.
Failed parsing response from SRV-1.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.RunMotors(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Run motors connected to SRV-1 robot.
member.param: Time duration to run motors measured in number of 10 milliseconds (0 for infinity), [0, 255].

remarks.para: The method provides direct access to motors setting specified, speed to both motors connected to the SRV-1 robot. The maximum absolute speed equals to 127, but the sign specifies direction of motor's rotation (forward or backward).

para.note: The method sends 'Mabc' SRV-1 command (see SRV-1 Control Protocol), which uses 2nd and 3rd timers for controlling motors/servos.

remarks.para: The method stops both motors connected to the SRV-1 robot by calling method specifying 0 for motors' speed.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.EnableFailsafeMode(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables fail safe mode - setting motors' speed after timeout.

remarks.para: In the case if fail safe mode is enabled and no commands are received by SRV-1 robot withing 2 seconds, motors' speed will be set to the specified values. The command is very useful to instruct robot to stop if no other commands were sent within 2 last seconds (probably lost connection).
The method disable fail safe mode, which was set using method.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.ControlServos(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Direct servos control of SRV-1 robot.

para.note: The method sends 'sab' SRV-1 command (see SRV-1 Control Protocol), which controls 2nd bank of servos using 6th and 7th timers.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.ControlMotors(AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.MotorCommand)
member.summary: Control SRV-1 robot's motors using predefined commands.
member.param: Motor command to send to the SRV-1 Blackfin robot.

para.note: Controlling SRV-1 motors with this method is only available after at least one direct motor command is sent, which is done using or methods.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.SetQuality(System.Int32)

remarks.para: The method sets video quality, which is specified in [1, 8] range - 1 is the highest quality level, 8 is the lowest quality level.

para.note: Setting higher quality level and resolution may increase delays for other requests sent to SRV-1. So if robot is used not only for video, but also for controlling servos/motors, and higher response level is required, then do not set very high quality and resolution.

member.exception: Invalid quality level was specified.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.UltrasonicPing
member.returns: Returns array of ranges (distances) obtained from ultrasonic sensors. The ranges are measured in inches.

remarks.para: The method sends 'p' SRV-1 command (see SRV-1 Control Protocol), which gets values from ultrasonic ranging modules attached to pins 27, 28, 29, 30 with trigger on pin 18. Supports Maxbotics EZ0 and EZ1 ultrasonic modules.

remarks.para: The property keeps SRV-1 IP address if the class is connected to SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera, otherwise it equals to .
The property keeps SRV-1 port number if the class is connected to SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera, otherwise it equals to 0.
The property equals to if the class is connected to SRV-1 Blackfin robot/camera, otherwise it equals to .

para.note: The property is not updated by the class, when connection was lost or communication failure was detected (which results into exception). The property only shows status of method.

remarks.para: This enumeration defines set of motors' commands, which can be executed using method.

para.note: Controlling SRV-1 motors with these commands is only possible after at least one direct motor command is sent, which is done using or methods.

The IncreaseSpeed and DecreaseSpeed commands do not have any effect unless another driving command is sent. In other words, these do not increase/decrease speed of current operation, but affect speed of all following commands.

The RotateLeft and RotateRight commands may be useful only for the original Surveyor SRV-1 Blackfin Robot. For most of other robots, which may have different motors and moving base, these commands will not be accurate will not rotate for 20 degrees.

member.name: T:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1.VideoResolution
member.summary: Enumeration of Surveyor SRV-1 Blackfin cameras resolutions.

member.name: T:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera
member.summary: Provides access to video stream from Surveyor SRV-1 Blackfin camera.

remarks.para: The class allows to continuously receive video frames from Surveyor SRV-1 Blackfin camera. It creates a background thread and periodically requests new video frames from SRV-1 robot/camera, which are provided to user through event. The video frame rate can be configured using property, which sets time interval between frames.
In order to get instance of this class, use or methods.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.Start
member.remarks: Starts video source and return execution to caller. Video source object creates background thread and notifies about new frames with the help of event.
member.exception: Not connected to SRV-1. Connection to SRV-1 was closed using method. New instance must be obtained using or methods.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signal video source to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals video source to stop its background thread, stop to provide new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait for video source has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for video source stopping after it was signalled to stop using method.

remarks.para: Stops video source aborting its thread.

para.note: Since the method aborts background thread, its usage is highly not preferred and should be done only if there are no other options. The correct way of stopping camera is signaling it to stop and then waiting for background thread's completion.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.SetQuality(System.Int32)

remarks.para: The method sets video quality, which is specified in [1, 8] range - 1 is the highest quality level, 8 is the lowest quality level.

para.note: Setting higher quality level and resolution may increase delays for other requests processed by class. So if robot is used not only for video, but also for controlling servos/motors, and higher response level is required, then do not set very high quality and resolution.

member.exception: Invalid quality level was specified.

para.note: Setting higher quality level and resolution may increase delays for other requests processed by class. So if robot is used not only for video, but also for controlling servos/motors, and higher response level is required, then do not set very high quality and resolution.

member.name: M:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.FlipVideo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Flip video capture or not (for use with upside-down camera).
member.param: Specifies if video should be flipped (), or not ().

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available frame from video source.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, because the video source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.VideoSourceError
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients that the video playing has finished.
The property sets the interval in milliseconds betwen frames. If the property is set to 100, then the desired frame rate will be 10 frames per second.
Default value is set to 0 - get new frames as fast as possible.
The property keeps connection string, which was used to connect to SRV-1 Blackfin camera.

member.name: P:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.FramesReceived
member.remarks: Number of frames the video source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.BytesReceived
member.remarks: Number of bytes the video source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:AForge.Robotics.Surveyor.SRV1Camera.IsRunning
member.remarks: Current state of video source object - running or not.
